name: PPG: Transforming Nauru’s Food Systems through Climate Smart Agriculture
description: The objective of the GEF PPG is to develop the project concept into a full project: “Transforming Nauru’s Food Systems through Climate Smart Agriculture”. As described in the child project concept note of the Food Systems Integrated Program (FSIP), this project aims to implement Nauru’s Climate Smart Agriculture Plan (NaCSAP) to contribute to food and nutrition security. NaCSAP is a holistic, island-wide approach that is vertically integrated and coordinated through a whole-of-government platform. There is also integration of national priorities such as reducing import dependency/ increasing food and nutrition security and addressing sustainable development, environmental conservation related commitments, and the SDGs.The project is designed to showcase sustainable food production systems within the context of Small Island Developing States (SIDS) to achieve food security, enhance nutrition diversity, and improve health and well-being while simultaneously protecting critical ecosystems, including coastal, marine, and vital freshwater resources. It aims to assist Nauru in incorporating nature-smart and climate-resilient food production solutions into the NaSCAP. These solutions are nature-smart by conserving freshwater, preventing coastal and marine pollution, managing plastic waste from tunnel agriculture, minimizing chemical inputs, and addressing invasive species management—a prevalent issue in the Pacific. Additionally, the project will employ innovative technologies to conserve land, water, and coastal areas. The climate-resilient aspects include water conservation measures, the utilization of weather-proof greenhouses, and the reduction of greenhouse gases (GHG) using renewable energy sources for cooling systems and fertilizer conveyance.
focusArea: Leaving no one behind

name: Global Plastics Offer (GPO) – Support the Start-up Phase
description: The purpose of the Initiation Plan is to develop a Project Document and to undertake early-stage activities necessary for the operationalizing of UNDP’s Global Plastics Offer. The Initiation Plan will serve as the primary document for formalizing global plastics partnerships with the NCE BPPS team until the Global Plastics Offer Project Document (ProDoc) is finalized. Once the Global Plastics Offer ProDoc is finalzed, the Global Plastics Offer Initiation Plan will be closed and the Global Plastics Offer ProDoc will serve as the primary document for formalizing global plastics partnerships.
focusArea: Structural transformation, including green, inclusive and digital transitions

name: Circular Solutions to Plastic Pollution (PPG)
description: PPG Circular Solutions to Plastic Pollution in Costa Rica.The objective of the GEF PPG is to develop the project concept into a full project: Circular Solutions to Plastic Pollution in Costa Rica. As described in the project child project concept note, the project main objective is to reduce the amount of plastic that the food and beverage industry put on the market and incentivize them to implement circular solutions to plastic packaging
focusArea: Leaving no one behind

name: Global Plastics Innovation Program (GPIP): Addressing Plastic Pollution through Policy, Innovation, and Awareness Raising
description: Global Plastics Innovation Program (GPIP): Addressing Plastic Pollution through Policy, Innovation, and Awareness Raising
focusArea: Structural transformation, including green, inclusive and digital transitions

name: Circular Economy for the Recovery of Waste Transition
description: The Circular Economy for the Recovery of Waste Transition (CERO Waste Transition) builds on and intends to further the successes of the pilot phase to consolidate a foundation for a scalable transition to an inclusive and climate-resilient circular economy (CE), targeting the plastic waste stream, that accounts for Samoa’s second largest waste stream and a problematic source of terrestrial and marine ecosystem pollution and degradation. As plastic waste pollution and its associated environmental impacts are exacerbated by multiple factors, a holistic approach is proposed that integrates convening power, systems thinking, institutional capacity building, education and awareness-building, technological innovation and on-the-ground action to accelerate the transition to a CE, leveraging actors from across the public, private and civil society sector due to the multi-stakeholder nature of the issue.
focusArea: Structural transformation, including green, inclusive and digital transitions

name: Reduction of POPs & U-POPs
description: The project intends to ensure integrated solid waste management towards zero waste and a circular economy vision for Eswatini. The main focus of the waste streams in this project includes healthcare waste, e-waste, and plastic waste. The project will help reduce pollution from chemicals and waste, improve the health and livelihoods of the general population and workers through a gender-responsive approach, and foster green growth through public and private partnerships in the services of waste management and circular businesses, particularly SMEs.
focusArea: Structural transformation, including green, inclusive and digital transitions

name: PPG Sustainable solutions to plastic pollution in Senegal
description: The objective of the GEF PPG is to develop the project concept into a full project: Sustainable Solutions to Plastics Pollution in Senegal. As described in the project child project concept note, this project seeks to reduce the use and disposal of single use plastics from the food and beverage sector in Senegal
focusArea: Structural transformation, including green, inclusive and digital transitions

name: PIMS-9629 PPG - Circular solutions to plastic pollution in The Dominican Republic
description: The objective of the GEF PPG is to develop the project concept into a full project: Circular Solutions to Plastic Pollution in the Dominican Republic. As described in the project child project concept note, the project main objective is to decrease the production and waste of plastic packaging through a focus on a circular economy in the sector of Food & Beverage (F&B), building up on and fueling existing un-financed national policy frameworks and roadmaps.
focusArea: Structural transformation, including green, inclusive and digital transitions

name: Circular Solution to Plastic Pollution
description: to promote Jordan transition to circular economy model with focus on plastic waste
focusArea: Structural transformation, including green, inclusive and digital transitions

name: Global Plastics Offer (GPO) – Support the Start-up Phase (Engagement Facility)
description: UNDP entered into a global partnership with the Ocean Cleanup in support of the implementation of UNDP’s Plastics Offer. The goal of the partnership is to jointly develop solutions for the reduction of leakages of plastics into marine ecosystems from rivers, basins and terrestrial and marine resources through deployment of technologies, policy advocacy and behavior change. This global partnership builds on the experiences and lessons learned from the national level cooperation between UNDP-Dominican Republic and the Ocean Cleanup. Eight priority countries have been identified for this partnership considering various factors including pollution status, existing relationship, and past/ongoing plastic work. The 8 countries are Thailand, Vietnam, Indonesia, Malaysia, India, Dominican Republic, Guatemala, and Jamaica.

name: PPG - Reducing PBDE and UPOPs
description: Reducing Releases of Polybromodiphenyl Ethers (PBDE) and Unintentional Persistent Organic Pollutants (UPOPs) Originating from Unsound Waste Management and Recycling Practices and the Manufacturing of Plastics in Indonesia

name: PIMS-9537 URU/24/G31 PPG Towards a more circular Uruguay
description: The objective of the GEF PPG is to develop the project concept into a full project: Towards a more circular Uruguay (Uruguay + Circular). As described in the project concept, this project aims to strengthen institutional and legal capacities and financial instruments for the transition to a circular economy, to apply circular models, including financial instruments, to food, plastics, vehicles, construction value chains with a socioinclusive approach and to disseminate knowledge and information to all stakeholders in the whole society to promote sustainable consumption and production pattern

name: National Plastic Action Partnership in the Philippines
description: Plastic pollution is recognized as a symptom of deeper systemic issues, including unsustainable production and consumption patterns, inadequate waste management infrastructure, legal frameworks, and enforcement, as well as economic, behavioral, and political factors. There is a pressing need for holistic solutions that address these root causes comprehensively.The National Plastic Action Partnership (NPAP) is a collaborative initiative spearheaded by the World Economic Forum (WEF) and the Global Plastic Action Partnership (GPAP). Its aim is to tackle the global challenge of plastic pollution by bringing together stakeholders from various sectors to develop and implement strategies that reduce plastic pollution and transition towards a circular economy. This can be achieved through 1) establishing organizational and operation procedures of NPAP and developing stakeholder engagement mechanism, 2) generate evidences from studies that feed into national action roadmap and community engagement, and 3) strengthening coordination and collaborations for initiatives on plastic action.UNDP Philippines will act as the NPAP Secretariat for the Philippines. The NPAP Secretariat in the Philippines will play a critical role in coordinating and implementing the NPAPs initiatives in the country.

name: The NAP on Marine Plastic Litter (PPG)
description: The Initiation Plan (PPG): Supporting the Implementation of the National Action Plan on Marine Plastic Litter in the context of Green Recovery post-COVID 19 in Viet Nam
focusArea: Structural transformation, including green, inclusive and digital transitions

name: UNCTAD UNDP WORKSHOP
description: Organization of a 3-day regional workshop in Suva, Fiji entitled: “Regional Indo-Pacific workshop on oceans economy, plastic pollution, and plastic substitutes” including related substantive and logistical elements. The workshop will assist countries in the Indo-pacific region to better understand material substitutes as part of solutions under SDG 14.1 and 12. The activity will also assist in building a stronger voice of Pacific Nations in multilateral processes on plastic pollution, including the WTO Dialogue on Plastic Pollution and the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee towards a binding international instrument on plastic pollution.
focusArea: Structural transformation, including green, inclusive and digital transitions

name: Costa Rica National Plastic Action Partnership (CR-NPAP) Initiative
description: Iniciativa de Plataforma Nacional de Accion sobre los Plásticos (Costa Rica)The project aims to serve as the National Plastic Action Partnership (NPAP) Secretariat and host organization in Costa Rica, fostering multi-stakeholder collaboration to implement innovative, sustainable, and inclusive solutions to eliminate plastic pollution. By enhancing partnerships, increasing awareness, and driving behavioral change, the project seeks to align national efforts with global standards, contributing significantly to the sustainable development goals (SDGs) and protecting Costa Ricas rich biodiversity and marine environment
focusArea: Leaving no one behind
